name: Adams, David A.
title: Board Member / Former Director, National Museum Program Division
notes: Retired U.S. Navy Captain who commanded USS Santa Fe (SSN 763) and USS Georgia (SSGN 729B). After retirement served as Director of Navy Museums (2018-2022) and Director, National Museum Program Division (2024-2025) for Naval History and Heritage Command. Award-winning defense writer and Contributing Editor to U.S. Naval Institute Proceedings.

name: Berline, Alexander J.
title: Partner
notes: California attorney and Partner at Hanson Bridgett LLP in San Francisco, specializing in insurance coverage disputes and policyholder representation. He has handled complex nationwide elder care, asbestos, construction, product defect, and environmental coverage cases. Selected to Super Lawyers for 2023 and 2025; JD from University of San Francisco School of Law (1991).

name: Brose, William George
title: Clinical Professor of Anesthesia, Perioperative and Pain Medicine (Emeritus)
notes: Physician who founded the Stanford University Pain Service in 1989 and has over 30 years of clinical experience in pain medicine. He graduated from University of Kansas School of Medicine in 1984 and remains a Clinical Professor engaged in teaching at Stanford. His private practice website is brosepain.com.

name: Carmassi, Herman L.
title: Certified Public Accountant / Principal
notes: California CPA and principal of Herman L. Carmassi Accountancy Corporation, with offices in Orinda and Walnut Creek, California. Born in 1934, he has provided tax preparation, bookkeeping, and accounting services to individuals and small businesses in the San Francisco Bay Area for decades.

name: Clopp, Larry
title: Operations (MBA)
notes: San Francisco Bay Area technology and operations executive with over 40 years of experience in management consulting and international trade. Previously led Accenture's Global Trade practice, served as CEO of Intelleflex and Serendipity Chocolates, and held International Operations roles at Adobe Systems and Amdahl. Holds an MBA in International Business from Golden Gate University.

name: Ervin, Howard G.
title: Vice President, Legal Affairs (retired/part-time)
notes: Attorney who guided Cerus Corporation (a Concord, California biomedical products company focused on blood safety) in legal affairs since the company's founding in 1991. He retired from his full-time role but continued in a part-time capacity. Holds a BA from Harvard College and a JD from University of Chicago Law School.

name: Fuller, John M. Jr.
title: Executive
notes: Executive associated with FSS Technologies, a physical security and life safety solutions company based in Des Plaines, Illinois. Specific biographical details and title could not be confirmed from public sources.

name: Fuller, Richard L.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Richard L. Fuller associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals with this name exist in public records.

name: Galvin, Eugene G. M.D.
employer: Kaiser Permanente South San Francisco Medical Center
title: Orthopedic Surgeon
notes: Board-certified orthopedic surgeon based in South San Francisco, California, affiliated with Kaiser Permanente South San Francisco Medical Center. He graduated from Saint Louis University School of Medicine in 1968 and has over 57 years of clinical experience. He speaks English and Spanish.

name: Gonzalez, Gemi Jose
title: Socio Director / CEO
notes: Mexican attorney and international affairs consultant with a PhD in International Law and International Relations from Universidad Complutense de Madrid. Previously served as Consul General of Mexico in San Francisco, Deputy Attorney General for Environmental Crimes (PROFEPA), and Chief of Staff of Mexico's Secretary of Communications and Transportation under the Peña Nieto administration.

name: Hall, Fred Jones
notes: No specific individual named Fred Jones Hall associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp could be confirmed from public records. This name does not appear to match Fred J. Hall, Chairman and CEO of Hall Capital in Oklahoma City, who has the same family name but is based in a different region.

name: Harvey, Thomas E.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Thomas E. Harvey associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals named Thomas Harvey exist in California public records including attorneys and executives.

name: Heidrich, A. Grant
title: Partner Emeritus
notes: Venture capitalist with 29 years at Mayfield Fund, where he was Managing Director for Funds IV-X and co-managed Mayfield's healthcare initiative. Holds an MBA from Columbia University and a BA in Human Biology from Stanford. Received the National Venture Capital Association Lifetime Achievement Award in 2009. Also serves as a Strategic Advisor at The Column Group.
ngos: National Venture Capital Association (Former Board Member); Western Association of Venture Capitalists (Former President); Octave Bioscience (Board Member)
political_donations: Democratic donor; contributed to Biden for President ($1,000), Amy McGrath for Senate ($2,500), and ActBlue in 2020. Has donated in 2018, 2010, and 2000 cycles.

name: Hewlett, William A.
title: Investor / Foundation Board Member
notes: Son of HP co-founder William Redington Hewlett (Bill Hewlett) and Flora Lamson Hewlett. Added to the William and Flora Hewlett Foundation board of directors in 1972 alongside his brother James S. Hewlett. As a son of Bill Hewlett, he is a beneficiary of the HP legacy and family philanthropy network.
ngos: William and Flora Hewlett Foundation (Former Board Member)

name: Heydorn, William H.
title: Surveyor (retired)
notes: Retired U.S. Army Colonel and surgeon who spent his medical career at Letterman Army Medical Center at the Presidio of San Francisco, becoming Chief of the Department of Surgery in 1978 and Commanding Officer in 1987. After retiring from the Army in 1989, he served as a Clinical Professor of Surgery at UCSF, then became a worldwide hospital surveyor for Joint Commission International. Received Hope College Distinguished Alumni Award in 2011. He passed away on January 30, 2025.

name: Hill, Brian A.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Brian A. Hill associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals named Brian Hill exist in California.

name: Hill, Kent Walthall
title: Senior Fellow for Eurasia, Middle East, and Islam
notes: American academic administrator and government official (born May 24, 1949) with a PhD in History from the University of Washington. Served as USAID Assistant Administrator for Europe and Eurasia (2001-2005), USAID Assistant Administrator for Global Health (2005-2009), and briefly as Acting USAID Administrator (January 2009). Previously was President of Eastern Nazarene College (1992-2001) and Senior VP at World Vision U.S. (2011-2016).
ngos: Religious Freedom Institute (Senior Fellow); World Vision (Former Senior VP)

name: Hill, Scott Clayton
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Scott Clayton Hill associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp.

name: Hopcroft, Michael Joseph
title: Distinguished Engineer
notes: Distinguished Engineer at Microsoft based in Kirkland, Washington, known for technical depth in large-scale AI systems, cloud infrastructure, and security. Notable contributions to Bing search include work on BitFunnel and Bloom filter-based indexing. Grew up interested in electronics and wrote video games for Atari in high school; studied electrical engineering before joining the computer industry.

name: James, John K.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a John K. James associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals with this name exist in California and nationally.

name: McQuade, Donald A.
title: Professor Emeritus of English / Vice Chancellor Emeritus
notes: Influential UC Berkeley English professor (born 1941 in Brooklyn, died September 2024) who was founding dean of American Studies, founder of the College Writing Program, and Vice Chancellor for University Relations (1999-2006). Also co-founded WriteLab, an AI-based student writing platform. Chaired the National Writing Project board (2008-2012) and the Conference on College Composition and Communication.
ngos: National Writing Project (Former Board Chair); Conference on College Composition and Communication (Former Chair)

name: Metheny, Johnny
employer: Ranch Water (San Rafael) / Bar and Hospitality Ventures
title: Owner / Proprietor
notes: San Francisco Bay Area bartender, restaurateur, and spirits entrepreneur known as 'Johnny Love.' Graduated from UC Berkeley with a degree in Economics and was a three-time national rugby champion. Founded the legendary Johnny Love's bar and grill chain in San Francisco, launched Johnny Love Vodka in 2004, and most recently opened Ranch Water in San Rafael (2024). Inducted into the Bartender's Hall of Fame by Bartender's Magazine.

name: Morrison, Richard H. Jr.
title: Investment Adviser / Wealth Management Consultant
notes: Born 1936, Lafayette, California resident who operates as a registered investment adviser. Public records show him residing at Chaparral Lane, Lafayette, CA. Limited biographical detail is publicly available; SEC IAPD lists him as a registered investment adviser firm principal.

name: Padian, Kevin
title: Professor Emeritus of Integrative Biology / Curator of Paleontology Emeritus
notes: American paleontologist (born 1951) and Professor Emeritus of Integrative Biology at UC Berkeley and Curator of Paleontology at the UC Museum of Paleontology. Retired in 2020. Served as President of the National Center for Science Education (NCSE) for 18 years and was an expert witness for the plaintiffs in the Kitzmiller v. Dover intelligent design trial. Received Carl Sagan Prize for Science Popularization (2003).
ngos: National Center for Science Education (Former President, Board Member); Kensington Fire Protection District (Board Member)

name: Peckler, Josh M.
title: Certified Public Accountant / Partner
notes: San Francisco CPA with California license number 27018, operating at 450 Sutter Street, Suite 920, San Francisco. He is a partner at Peckler Kolling Tompkins Woodul LLP, a firm founded in 1981. Previously was President of P & E Payroll Corporation (now dissolved). Provides tax preparation, estate and trust taxes, and planning services.

name: Poland, Bill R.
title: Founder and Chairman
notes: San Francisco Bay Area real estate developer who founded Bay West Group in 1979, a diversified real estate development firm with subsidiaries including Bay West Development, Pacific Development, and BlueWave Express Car Wash (48 locations). Lives in Ross, CA. Holds a BE from Georgia Tech (1967) and MBA from Stanford. Past president of the Olympic Club of San Francisco.
ngos: Buck Institute for Research on Aging (Chairman Emeritus, former Board Chair); Urban Land Institute (Member); Steers Global Real Estate Center at Georgetown University (Board Member); Georgia Tech Presidents Advisory Board (Member)
political_donations: Democratic donor; contributed $2,800 to Biden for President (2020) and $500 to Unite America (2019). Donated $9,400 in 2018 cycle.

name: Rafferty, Joseph V.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Joseph V. Rafferty associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals named Joseph Rafferty exist in California and nationally.

name: Rhodes, John W. Jr.
title: Professor Emeritus of Mathematics
notes: American mathematician (born July 16, 1937) and Professor Emeritus at UC Berkeley, known as co-developer of Krohn-Rhodes theory in semigroup and automata theory. Spent his entire teaching career at UC Berkeley. His 1969 book is a founding work in algebraic engineering. Holds a PhD from MIT.

name: Rodriguez, Carlos A.
title: Former President and CEO; current Non-Employee Director
notes: Cuban-American business executive (born 1965) who served as CEO and President of ADP from November 2011 through December 2022, then transitioned to Executive Chair and now serves as a non-employee director. His family fled Cuba in the 1960s. Holds a BA and MBA from Harvard University. Also serves on the boards of Hubbell Inc. and Microsoft.
ngos: Business Roundtable (Member); A-T Children's Project (Board Member); American Heart Association CEO Roundtable (Member)
political_donations: Bipartisan donor in 2008 ($21,100 total): donated to John McCain, Hillary Clinton, Obama for America, and Republican National Committee. Also donated $9,145 in 2012 cycle.

name: Scibetta, W. Craig
title: Anesthesiology Specialist
notes: Anesthesiologist who graduated with honors from Georgetown University School of Medicine in 1993. Holds medical licenses in both Arizona and California, with primary practice in Phoenix, AZ and an additional office in Greenbrae, California. Associated with a medical group of 43 members. Over 33 years of professional experience.

name: Taylor, Mark Robert
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Mark Robert Taylor associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp. Multiple individuals named Mark Taylor exist in California.

name: Thurlow, Stephen C.

name: Tomsic, Ronald P.
title: National Client Development Leader (retired)
notes: 1956 Olympic gold medalist in basketball (Team USA) and former Stanford University All-PCC guard (1951-1955) who scored 1,416 career points, then a Stanford record. Born in Oakland, CA. After his playing career, worked in insurance and risk management, holding a National Client Development Leader role at Marsh. Also previously with Aon Risk Solutions. Served as a Commissioner for the 1984 Los Angeles Olympic Organizing Committee.

name: Torner, Thomas A.
notes: No specific biographical information could be confirmed for a Thomas A. Torner associated with the Bohemian Grove Highlanders camp.

name: Townsend, Lawrence G.
employer: Law Offices of Lawrence G. Townsend
title: Principal / Intellectual Property Attorney
notes: Intellectual property attorney based in San Francisco with 40+ years of experience in copyright, trademark, trade secrets, and unfair competition law. Born 1951 in Berkeley; fourth-generation IP specialist in the San Francisco Bay Area. Received his BA from UC Santa Barbara and JD from University of San Francisco School of Law (1979). Also author of the satiric novel 'Secrets of the Wholly Grill' (Carroll & Graf, 2002).
